alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 9:51PM AKST until December 08 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches for the Anchorage Bowl. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches for the Anchorage Hillside. South winds gusting as high as 25 mph across the Anchorage Bowl. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of moderate to heavy snow will continue through late this evening. The combination of snowfall rates of up to an inch per hour, the dry nature of the snow resuspended by vehicular travel, and the gusty south winds may significantly reduce visibility to as low as one half mile at times. The snow is expected to become lighter in intensity tonight before slowly tapering off Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
